# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651?src=pr&el=h1) Report
> Merging [#20651](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651?src=pr&el=desc) into [master](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/commit/4e6aa1c012d91d663edcfd13658a35f88a49da30?src=pr&el=desc) will **decrease** coverage by `0.02%`.
> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651/graphs/tree.svg?width=650&height=150&src=pr&token=eZ4WkYLtcO)](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651?src=pr&el=tree)

```diff
@@            Coverage Diff             @@
##           master   #20651      +/-   ##
==========================================
- Coverage   91.83%   91.81%   -0.03%     
==========================================
  Files         153      153              
  Lines       49269    49270       +1     
==========================================
- Hits        45247    45238       -9     
- Misses       4022     4032      +10
```

| #single | `41.9% <ø> (ø)` | :arrow_up: |

|---|---|---|

| [pandas/core/indexes/datetimes.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL2NvcmUvaW5kZXhlcy9kYXRldGltZXMucHk=) | `95.73% <0%> (ø)` | :arrow_up: |
| [pandas/util/testing.py](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-cGFuZGFzL3V0aWwvdGVzdGluZy5weQ==) | `84.59% <0%> (+0.2%)` | :arrow_up: |

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [4e6aa1c...4e0ec35](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/20651?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

side issue: do we have tests constructing (and raising) non-supported dtypes, e.g. ``int16``. They raise on directly constructing an ``IntervalTree``, so should add some tests for this (I believe have tests directly constructing an II)

this is generating lots of build warnings


Looking into the warnings. The warnings I get are similar but slightly different,; guessing it's a compiler thing.  I have a fix that addresses the warnings, but it causes an `OverflowError` instead of a `KeyError` when querying negative values on a `uint64` dtype `IntervalTree`.  Trying to find a way to gracefully handle it.

> do we have tests constructing (and raising) non-supported dtypes, e.g. int16. They raise on directly constructing an IntervalTree, so should add some tests for this

Also added a test for this on my warnings fix branch, and made some minor changes to yield a more informative error.
